outputs.output_descr:
Output 1.1 Preparation and adoption of NAP
Output 2.1 Stakeholders able to identify root causes of land degradation 
Output 2.2 local leaders and community members made aware and trained on SLM practices
Output 2.3. Field staff and researchers exposed to various options of SLM practices
Output 2.4 Institutes define and identify local specific best land management practices 
Output 2.5 Policy/decision makers exposed and educated on land degradation issues 
Output 3.1. Land Management Campaign conducted through pilot site demonstrations   
Output 3.2 Land degradation issues recognized by the line departments, ministries and local institutes
Output 3.3 Geogs, dzongkhags  and departments incorporate SLM concepts in annual plans
 Output 3.4 Resources/facilities shared between and among departments and institutes to address land degradation.
Output 3.5 A formal forum established to share experiences on SLM programs. 
Output 4.1 Long term research on risk/hazard assessment  identified  
Output 4.2 Alternative Economic opportunities under dry land farming defined for funding.
Output 4.3: Potential areas for synergy of three conventions of UN identified.   
Output 4.4: Identification of funding (for further targeted capacity development and on-the ground investment)

project_descr: Build Capacity & Mainstreaming of Sustainable Land Management in Bhutan
project_title: Build Capacity & Mainstream Sustainable Land in Bhutan
